byline.contributor: Ceylan Yeginsu contributed reporting from Istanbul, and Michael D. Shear from Cleveland.
byline.original: By TIM ARANGO and BEN HUBBARD

abstract: Turkish Pres Recep Tayyip Erdogan claims Fethullah Gulen, mild-mannered Muslim cleric living in self-imposed exile in Pennsylvania, was behind failed military coup and that thousands of Turkish citizens are part of his movement and deserve punishment; is demanding that United States extradite Gulen, request likely to raise tensions between NATO allies.
lead_paragraph: President Recep Tayyip Erdogan says Fethullah Gulen was behind a coup attempt last week that almost succeeded in taking over the state and killing Mr. Erdogan himself.

headline.main: Turkey Pursues Cleric Living in U.S., Blamed as Coup Mastermind
headline.print_headline: With Coup Crushed, Turkish Leaders Pursue a Rival in the U.S.

snippet: President Recep Tayyip Erdogan says Fethullah Gulen was behind a coup attempt last week that almost succeeded in taking over the state and killing Mr. Erdogan himself....

keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
keywords.name: subject
